examples: The laws were reformed root and branch.
Boys his age are a law unto themselves.
The law went into effect on 1 August.
The law was changed in 2001.
Important new laws are already in the pipeline.
words.defineEn: a country's rules that all of its citizens are required to obey
words.defineVi: quy tắc của một quốc gia mà tất cả các công dân của nó được yêu cầu phải tuân theo

words.defineEn: to officially state that something, such as a principle or rule must be obeyed
words.defineVi: để chính thức tuyên bố rằng một cái gì đó, chẳng hạn như một nguyên tắc hoặc quy tắc phải được tuân theo

examples: NordVPN is legit.
That's legit, man.
That's legit, man.
This is legit.
Is exfoliation legit?
words.defineEn: conformable or authorized by the law
words.defineVi: phù hợp hoặc được pháp luật cho phép

words.defineEn: the quality of being more compassionate, merciful, or permissive than expected, especially in terms of punishment in a court case
words.defineVi: phẩm chất của sự từ bi, thương xót hoặc dễ dãi hơn mong đợi, đặc biệt là về hình phạt trong một vụ án

examples: Here, this is much more lenient.
We're not more lenient with the stars.
America has more lenient policies than other countries, including those that pay for plasma.
Pruitt had backed a more lenient state plan to reduce emissions that was favored by the company.
And when the rioters are brought to the court, when their verdict is being handed down by the court, it seems that, on many occasion, the sentence is too lenient.
words.defineEn: (of a person) showing mercy, flexibility, or tolerance, particularly while obeying rules or punishing someone
words.defineVi: (của một người) thể hiện lòng thương xót, linh hoạt hoặc khoan dung, đặc biệt là khi tuân theo các quy tắc hoặc trừng phạt ai đó

words.defineEn: in a manner that is less strict when punishing someone or when enforcing a law
words.defineVi: theo cách ít nghiêm khắc hơn khi trừng phạt ai đó hoặc khi thi hành luật

words.defineEn: ‌to allow a usual rule to be bypassed or ignored in a particular circumstance or for a specific purpose
words.defineVi: ‌để cho phép bỏ qua hoặc bỏ qua một quy tắc thông thường trong một trường hợp cụ thể hoặc cho một mục đích cụ thể

examples: All men must die.
The show must go on!
You must have that angle off down pat.
The sign must be taken down.
You must have a cast-iron stomach.
words.defineEn: used to show that something is very important and needs to happen
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để cho thấy rằng một cái gì đó là rất quan trọng và cần phải xảy ra

examples: Make the necessary preparations.
Standing on the shoulders of giants is a necessary part of creativity
Experts have urged ministers to take the necessary steps to resolve the issue.
If we make the necessary changes now, it will save us money in the long run.
Breakfast plays an important role as it provides the body with the necessary energy and nutrients to start the day.
words.defineEn: unavoidable; must exist, happen, or be achieved
words.defineVi: không thể tránh khỏi; phải tồn tại, xảy ra, hoặc đạt được

examples: As the saying goes, necessity is the mother of invention.
For all younger people in the US saving for retirement will be an absolute necessity.
Too many companies reckon without the pitfalls that make insurance like this an absolute necessity.
When he lost his driver's license, he made a virtue out of necessity and got in shape by riding his bike to work.
He wanted to help the poor family who were struggling to afford basic necessities like food and clothing.
words.defineEn: the fact that something must happen or is needed
words.defineVi: thực tế là một cái gì đó phải xảy ra hoặc là cần thiết

examples: The soup needs a little more seasoning.
This shirt needs washing.
My father's car needs an oil change.
I need a lightweight sweater for the spring season.
We need a new brush for our pet's fur.
words.defineEn: a condition or situation in which something is necessary
words.defineVi: một điều kiện hoặc tình huống trong đó một cái gì đó là cần thiết

examples: Non-compliance of wealthy and powerful colonists was common and many of the laws were not enforced in fear of rebellion.
Another thing that can drive non-compliance with treatment is people forgetting what it was like when they were doing so poorly.
words.defineEn: refusal to behave as expected or failure to obey or follow rules, commands, etc.
words.defineVi: từ chối cư xử như mong đợi hoặc không tuân theo hoặc tuân theo các quy tắc, mệnh lệnh, v.v.

words.defineEn: failure to comply with a rule, obligation, etc.
words.defineVi: không tuân thủ một quy tắc, nghĩa vụ, v.v.

examples: I am the elder statesman of the team and it is my obligation to pick up the cudgels for our ballclub.
I assure you that our company has opened our kimono about every aspect of our tax obligations to the state.
A lotta students have obligations outside of school.

What are the obligations.
words.defineEn: the state of being forced to do something in a way that conforms to the law or is morally acceptable
words.defineVi: tình trạng bị buộc phải làm điều gì đó theo cách phù hợp với pháp luật hoặc được chấp nhận về mặt đạo đức

examples: These are obligatory.
Obligatory I am leaving.
The five pillars of Islam are the basic acts considered obligatory, at least by Sunni Muslims.
And you know, the obligatory girl who wants to touch Paul's chest hair, you know, and do that stuff.
First, the obligatory unboxing now.
words.defineEn: required or necessary as a result of a rule or law
words.defineVi: bắt buộc hoặc cần thiết như là kết quả của một quy tắc hoặc pháp luật

words.defineEn: feeling that something must be done because it is morally proper or mandatory
words.defineVi: cảm thấy rằng một cái gì đó phải được thực hiện bởi vì nó là đúng về mặt đạo đức hoặc bắt buộc

examples: Earth Day is observed on April 22nd to promote environmental awareness.
We used a telescope to observe distant stars and galaxies.
We examined the caryopsis of the rice grain under the microscope, observing its unique structure.
They were crouching in the bushes, observing the wildlife.
She congratulated herself still more on observing in the course of days that Mr Verloc seemed to be taking kindly to Stevie's companionship.
words.defineEn: to comply with laws or regulations
words.defineVi: để tuân thủ pháp luật hoặc quy định

words.defineEn: something that is considered as one's responsibility or moral obligation
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó được coi là trách nhiệm hoặc nghĩa vụ đạo đức của một người

words.defineEn: used when an agreement can only be reached under a specific condition
words.defineVi: được sử dụng khi một thỏa thuận chỉ có thể đạt được trong một điều kiện cụ thể

examples: They ordered a mouthwatering venison burger from a trendy restaurant.
She ordered a takeaway meal of pizza and garlic bread for dinner.
We ordered takeout pizza for an easy dinner.
I ordered a bowl of delicious oxtail soup for the first time.
Three players got their marching orders last week.
words.defineEn: to give an instruction to someone to do something, using one's authority
words.defineVi: để đưa ra một hướng dẫn cho ai đó làm điều gì đó, sử dụng thẩm quyền của một người

examples: In the example of the anti-food-truck ordinance, the barrier to entry was government regulation, but what some other ways companies maintain large market shares?
The ordinance outlawed slavery in all five of the new states.
FEMA is very good with working with communities to help them bring their codes and ordinances up to meet the NFIP standards.

From 18th century ordinances that required slaves in New York to carry lanterns after dark to the FBI wiretapping of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., to stop and frisk policies that disproportionately target people of color.

words.defineVi: một quy tắc hoặc lệnh chính thức được áp đặt bởi luật pháp hoặc người có thẩm quyền

The robbers led police on a high-speed chase through the city.
Police still haven't made heads nor tails of the heist.

words.defineEn: maintain the security of by carrying out a patrol
words.defineVi: duy trì an ninh bằng cách thực hiện một cuộc tuần tra

examples: What he lacks in book knowledge he makes up with his street smarts and policing instincts, which often prove equally helpful to the investigation.

words.defineEn: the control and regulation of law and order by the police force or other official groups
words.defineVi: sự kiểm soát và quy định của pháp luật và trật tự của lực lượng cảnh sát hoặc các nhóm chính thức khác

examples: Already the preconditions were there.

I'm happy that they have set aside those preconditions.

words.defineEn: a condition that must be met or established before other things can occur or be considered
words.defineVi: một điều kiện phải được đáp ứng hoặc thiết lập trước khi những thứ khác có thể xảy ra hoặc được xem xét

examples: What it could mean is that this monitor just doesn't have full array local dimming, or any local dimming, which is a prerequisite for all levels of display HDR above 400.

words.defineEn: something that is required as a precondition for something else following
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó được yêu cầu như một điều kiện tiên quyết cho một cái gì đó khác theo sau

examples: What it could mean is that this monitor just doesn't have full array local dimming, or any local dimming, which is a prerequisite for all levels of display HDR above 400.
It was just viewed as a potential part of married life, rather than as a prerequisite of getting hitched.
I think it's like a prerequisite now on the office that you have to intern here because between me and John Krasinski and Angela Kinsey.
The CDC director said point blank that vaccinating teachers is not a prerequisite for opening across the country.
But it turns out, of course, that in World War II, such things were not prerequisites for getting bombed.
words.defineEn: necessary or indispensable as a prior condition before something else can happen
words.defineVi: cần thiết hoặc không thể thiếu như một điều kiện trước khi một cái gì đó khác có thể xảy ra

examples: The mountain provided a natural barrier between the two valleys.
The hotel provides fresh towels for the guests every day.
The tall oak tree provided shade on a hot summer day.
The coconut flakes provided a delightful crunch in the homemade granola.
The carob-covered almonds provided a delightful crunch and a hint of sweetness in every bite.

words.defineVi: (của một luật hoặc một quy tắc) để xác định rằng bắt buộc phải làm một việc gì đó
